definition[0]: to take care of someone by helping them, giving them what they need, or keeping them safe
example[0]: Don’t worry, I’ll look after the kids tomorrow.
example[1]: Susan looked after us very well. She’s an excellent cook.
example[2]: You could tell that the horse had been well looked after.
definition[1]: to be responsible for dealing with something
example[3]: I’m leaving you here to look after the business until I get back.
definition[2]: used when you are saying goodbye to someone in a friendly way
definition[3]: to not need anyone else to take care of you
example[4]: Don’t worry about Maisie – she can look after herself.
